sub_topic: Predicting the products of inorganic reactions
message_1: Given the reactants Copper(II) chloride and Sodium hydroxide, predict the products of the reaction and write the balanced chemical equation.
message_2:
The reaction between Copper(II) chloride (CuCl₂) and Sodium hydroxide (NaOH) is a double displacement reaction, which results in the formation of Copper(II) hydroxide (Cu(OH)₂) and Sodium chloride (NaCl). The balanced chemical equation for this reaction is:

CuCl₂ (aq) + 2 NaOH (aq) → Cu(OH)₂ (s) + 2 NaCl (aq)
